metadata.Title: CVE-2023-28366 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The broker in Eclipse Mosquitto 1.3.2 through 2.x before 2.0.16 has a memory leak that can be abused remotely when a client sends many QoS 2 messages with duplicate message IDs, and fails to respond to PUBREC commands. This occurs because of mishandling of EAGAIN from the libc send function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28366` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmosquitto1 - 1.6.9-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libmosquittopp1 - 1.6.9-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
mosquitto - 1.6.9-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
mosquitto-clients - 1.6.9-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
No subscription required

notes.Note: gianz> Memory leak requiring refactoring of core functions to be fixed. Applying the patches to versions < 2.0.0 is likely to cause regressions.

criterions.comment: mosquitto package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.9-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
